title: For Sale:  5.56 Hornady TAP, NATO pressure round, 8126N (Mk262), $255/200 round case
postcontent:
If you know what this is, you know how hard it is to come by. 

If you don't this is the NATO pressure law enforcement round. Please note, this ammunition will, not, function in a .223. This is the 75gr BTHP, T2 bullet, crimped primer, temperature stabilized ball powder. 

The T2 projectile is designed to maximize ballistic performance and feeding in the M4?M16 platform.  All the other Hornady TAP uses a different projectile, primer and most importantly short cut extruded powder.  So, if your squirreling this away you can store this stuff for years and years, hot or cold, wet or dry, it will not be a problem.

This ammo will get the very best out of any AR.  Further this round can reach out accurately with power!

For those unfamiliar, here's one good sources: 

http://www.ar15.com/forums/t_3_16/283506_.html 

I've been looking for some of this for months now and its pretty much unobtainable to us non LE folk. Subsequently I tried to source it through a couple of LE folks I know. Apparently its pretty much unobtainable to them as well. After much effort I finally found some but the only way to get it was to buy a metric s***load. 

I live in San Francisco. No tax, you come to San Francisco and pay me green, capitalist, American, cash I hand you ammo. No BS. This is new stock, in factory boxes.  I'm happy to ship it.  Lesson learned thus far, shipping three cases cost $3-$4 more than the $20-$24 its cost to ship one to different places.

For the record this is, not, a profit making venture. I paid $255/case after shippng. Yeah, yeah I know, I won't even say you're wrong, but that was then, and this is now.  Look around, if you can find this stuff, my price is darned reasonable.  Hornady will not be manufacturing any more of this in 2013.  For the determined Hornady's production schedule can be found on-line.  

I'm pretty confident I can sell it for this price in this environment. Therefore the price is not negotiable. If you're looking to negotiate, get married or take on a business partner. 


I can also be reached at eight eight eight, four eight two, one nine nine nine. This is the number for my architectural practice. It rings through to my cell if I'm in the field.  Please note, the 888 number does, not, receive texts.

UPDATE: 15 CASES LEFT

title: For Sale/Trade:  1946 K. Kale Mauser w/ 600 Rounds of 8mm Mauser
postcontent:
I have a 1946 K. Kale Mauser manufactured in Turkey.

From 1939-1946 the Turks manufactured new 8mm Mausers in Ankara, instead of piecing old Mauser parts together.  They marked them K. Kale.  They made 250,000ish of them from 1939-1946.  This is a 1946 K. Kale.

It is in good shape for being a 1946 rifle.  If only this old rifle could talk.  The wood has no cracks or repairs, and is very solid, but has a fair share of dings and scratches.  The bore is actually great for a non-chromed lined, 67-year old barrel.  It has very deep lands and grooves with very solid rifling.  All numbers match, except the bolt, but the chances of finding one with a matching bolt is more than 1000 to 1.

What's Included:
1946 K. Kale Turkish Mauser w/ Cleaning Rod and Sling
628 Rounds of 8mm Mauser on Stripper Clips in Bandoleers (8mm Mauser Surplus is drying up)

I am looking for $400 OBO
I will entertain trades.
E-mail me at the above address, and I will respond to every offer.

title: For Sale/Trade:  H & K USP Compact .45
postcontent:
The HK USP Compact is a small frame pistol capable of firing the most powerful cartridges in .45 ACP. Based on the full-size USP models, these handy pistols combine compact size with optimum effective shooting performance.
USP Compacts are smaller and lighter than large frame USPs. The reduction in trigger reach and grip circumference increases concealability and enhances shooting ergonomics. Unlike some subcompact semiautomatic pistols that use a difficult to shoot "two-finger grip" frame, the USP Compact uses a narrow, full-hand grip frame with a choice of interchangeable extended or flush-fitting magazine floorplates. This makes the pistol easy to shoot without sacrificing concealability.
Like their large frame predecessors, USP Compacts are designed with the demanding needs of the law enforcement and military shooters in mind. Using a modified linkless Browning-type action, the USP Compact is built to take the punishment of high-energy +P loads.
To reduce the length of the slide and barrel on the USP Compact, the mechanical recoil reduction system found on large frame USPs has been replaced by a specially designed flat compression spring contained in the captive recoil spring assembly by a polymer absorber bushing. Service life is still engineered to exceed 20,000 rounds.
Easy to shoot, simple to maintain; the USP Compact is a reliable, safe, accurate, and highly concealable pistol.
Features & System Characteristics:
    Corrosion proof fiber-reinforced polymer frame
    Grooved target triggers
    Polygonal bore profile for increased velocity, easier cleaning, and longer barrel life
    Can be converted to any of nine trigger firing modes
    Specially designed captive recoil spring assembly with polymer absorber bushing
    Choice of corrosion resistant “Hostile Environment” blued finish or stainless steel slide
    One piece machined slide made from nitro-carburized steel
    No snag, bobbed hammer
    Flared recurve trigger guard
    Choice of flat and extended floorplate magazines
    Universal mounting grooves for installing accessories
    Ambidextrous magazine release lever
    Contoured, extended slide release
    Extractor doubles as a loaded chamber indicator
    Patented Lock-Out Safety device
USP Compact Variants readily stocked in the USA:
704531-A5…USP .45 ACP Compact (V1) DA/SA, safety/decocking lever on left, with two 8 round magazines…$1,040.00

title: For Sale:  Mega 6.8SPC Upper Package
postcontent:
Ok so late last fall I decided I wanted to build up a 6.8 upper for my DMR lower I already had. Well it just so happens that I have yet to shoot more than 40 rounds through it to get it broken in and other wise it has just sat in my safe. I have since picked up an AR-10 pattern rifle and really no longer have a use for it so up for sale it goes. I really tried to use the best parts I could get my hands on and most are still unavailable today.

Components used-
-Mega Arms billet upper
-White Oak 6.8SPC 18" barrel
-Troy VTac 15" Alpha rail
-Gemtech Vortex flash hider/quickmount
-Precision Reflex 6.8SPC bolt

I never picked up a carrier for it since I was never able to locate one without a bolt.

The barrel was cerakoted Sniper Grey and assembled by Chris at Performance Arms here in Wichita. The work he does is phenomenal and one of the few people I trust with my rifles.

In addition to the upper I also have mags and ammo that will go with it.

25rd AR-Stoner 6.8SPC mag x1
10rd AR-Stoner 6.8SPC mag x2
Hornady 110gr V-Max (Factory Loaded) x10 boxes/200rds
Federal Fusion MSR 115gr Spitzer Boat Tail x6 boxes/120rds
Remington UMC 115gr FMJ x2 boxes/40rds
RAM 115gr FMJ (Factory New Loaded) x2 boxes/40rds
RAM 110gr Hornady V-Max (Factory New Loaded) x1 box/20rds
Hornady once fired brass x40pcs

That is a total of 420 rounds to get you started with. As I mentioned above the barrel was broken in properly per WOA instructions with Hornady 110gr V-Max and as sat since. I want to sell it as a whole package and would prefer not to split it up. I am looking to get $1250 for the lot. This would be a great option for someone wanting to get into a slightly bigger round over 5.56 while staying on your AR-15 lower. If you have any questions or would like pics shoot me a pm or txt 3I6-84I-27O4.

title: For Sale/Trade:  $400 trade for your firearm
postcontent:
No success selling or trading your firearm?   Have some bank invested in your home theater set up at home?  Or are you going to treat yourself to a nice home theater set up this Xmas?  Then this is the one piece of gear you need.  If your firearms have just been sitting there gathering dust or you're moved on to better firearms, perhaps we can help each other out.  I have  a brand new Furman home theater 7 outlet line conditioner. It is still in original box and has never been used.  Furman line conditioners are high end home theater power management/protection systems, not your cheap surge suppressor. There's a Furman Elite 15 which is $380+tax on Amazon.com right now.   If you have expensive home theater gadgets, you need this.
I don't mind you ending up with a slightly better trade, if we trade.. but I would like to keep the trade fairly close to current market prices.   So if your rifle is close to $150 in used value,  I wouldn't trade away the $399 Furman unit.  
I'm not interested in outlaying any cash...looking for outright trades only. Provide me details of your item (make, model, what's included, age, condition, number of rounds through it so I can fully research).  I would fully expect you to inspect and test my items should we get to that point....so please understand I'd like to do the same and would be open to your suggestions on how to op-test your rifle.  I'd waive that inspection if you're active duty or a Veteran.

title: For Sale:  Springfield XDM 3.8 9MM Compact w/Extras
postcontent:
I have a Springfield XDM 3.8" Compact 9MM for sale that has roughly 1000 rounds through it and was purchased 11/2012.  The gun has been outfitted with a PRP XDM Ultimate Match trigger as well as their calibration springs.  Currently the trigger pull is measured at 3.5LB approximate (Measured with a Lyman trigger pull gauge) and all friction surfaces (Except for striker) were micro polished by hand.  All safety features of the firearm are still 100% functional and these modifications are ESP legal in IDPA. This model is the newer model with the magpul flip-up rear sight. The only difference between this gun and it's much more expensive counterpart is that it has no dust cover or forward assist. Which in my opinion are totally unnecessary and only add extra weight.
The gun has only had about 150 rounds through it and let me tell you IT IS ACCURATE!!!  I have had 2 other AR15s and they both pale in comparasin to this one in the accuracy department. title: For Sale/Trade:  Zeiss Hensoldt RSA-S Red Dot (Military issue Z-Point)
location: Southeast of Springfield, in West Plains, Springfield, Missouri
postcontent:
I have used this sight in several competitions and even a defensive rifle class. This is a very compact, light weight red dot sight. It runs on a single CR2032 battery, and has a solar panel to supplement battery life (which must work since I have been using the same battery for the last two years), and uses a sensor to automatically adjust the 3.5 MOA dot's brightness level for the current surroundings. It has an integral QD mount that is very quick and easy to operate, and has held its zero very well for me (admittedly, I seldom shot past 100 yards with it). It has the fastest activation switch on any red dot I have ever used, with very easy controls: touch the switch to activate the sight, touch then hold the switch to raise the dot's intensity, and touch - touch - hold to lower the dot's intensity. It has an auto shut-off feature if left on for four continuous hours, or you can simply hold the switch down for three seconds to manually turn the sight off. The lenses are in very good condition, no apparent scratches that I can see. The body of the sight is in good condition as well, but the sight does exhibit some wear on the bar that fits between the picatinny rails. I am including the protective rubber cover and I will throw in a 3/4" riser (allows a proper lower 1/3 co-witness with your iron sights on an AR-15) that I cut short to fit this sight and leave room for a magnifier. I really like this sight, but I am consolidating my sights to those that take CR1/3N batteries or no batteries at all, and selling my others to build a little capital.

I am looking to trade for a used but decent Trijicon RX30, a Trijicon RMR, a Meprolight M-21, or an Aimpoint Comp M2/M3/C3/ML3/PRO, depending on the condition of your sight and the type of mount. Let me know what you have and what you're thinking and we can discuss a trade. I will take $395 to sell this outright. I am willing to meet locally or ship this at the buyer's expense. Thanks for looking, and please check out my other listings for a great deal on some new in the box Aimpoint CompM4's.

postcontent:
I have for sale a Burris FastFire 2 in perfect condition with Picatinny mount, lens cover, and wrench.  What looks like marks on the sight in the pics is actually camera flash and dust / lint.  My price is $170.  Pick up in N. Austin, or I can ship if everything is paid for in advance. Paypal is accepted if the fee is paid for by the buyer.  Additional information is below.

Burris FastFire II Red-Dot Reflex Sight w/ 4 MOA Dot Reticle Product Info

The Burris FastFire II Red Dot Sight dramatically increases aiming speed and accuracy. This red dot simplifies the act of aiming by eliminating the need to focus on and alignimage the front sight, rear sight and target. With the Burris FastFire 2 Red Dot Reflex Sight, the aiming dot and target are always in focus and properly aligned for the ultimate in accuracy. Originally developed as a red dot sight for semi-automatic handguns that could withstand the abuse of slide mounting, this tiny but tough, non-magnifying, reflex type red dot sight by Burris has proven to be a terrific fast target acquisition sight for turkey shotguns, deer slug guns, tactical and close range hunting carbines, muzzleloaders, paint ball guns, home defense shotguns and even upland and waterfowl shotguns. The Burris FastFire Red Dot Reflex Sight weighs in at just 2 ounces, fully mounted, and with its all metal housing construction and advanced circuitry, the Burris FastFire II Red Dot Sight w/ 4 MOA Dot Reticle is extremely robust, shrugging off recoil forces up to 1000 G's. A target directed light sensor automatically adjusts and controls the brightness of the 4MOA red dot reticle for maximum visibility based on the ambient light conditions - from very dim in dark conditions to very bright in sunlight. With unlimited eye relief, the Burris FastFire II Waterproof Red Dot Reflex Sight can be used on handguns, rifles and shotguns and its low magnification provides an extremely large field of view and the ability to aim with both eyes open.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Firearm refinishing tanks, lids, & chemicals - NEW
postcontent:
NEW parkerizing tanks, lids, & checmicals for refinishing your parkerized finish on your military weapons, 1911's or whatever else you would like. 

I have for sale 2 new/never used stainless steel parkerizing tanks with lids and ½” drain valves. I bought these thinking I was going to learn how to parkerize guns but never got around to it so these have just been sitting collecting dust. Also included with this is 1 gallon of Zinc Phosphate Parkerizing Solution and 1 gallon of Post Treatment Solution, both new and unopened. Each gallon of chemical is concentrated and gets mixed with 4 gallons of water for 5 total gallons of each, which is the capacity of each tank. 

I paid right around $450 shipped to the door for the pair of tanks/lids plus around $125 shipped to the door for the chemicals. I have around $575 wrapped up in this but I will sell everything as a set for $400 cash or $450 trade value. Located in Dublin and you must be willing to meet in the Dublin area for the sale. Trades considered would possibly be 12 ga. shotguns, rifles, handguns in 9mm (no Hi-Point, Kel-Tec, or Jennings), ammo in 9mm (brass cased), .22LR (high velocity only), .223 (40-52 grain, brass), .308 (155-168 grain, brass). Not interested in bows, crossbows, or black powder.

Here is the description of the tanks from the manufacturer:

6"x6"x40", pure 304 Stainless Steel. Tank, cover, and Stainless Steel ball valve are included. 

We are proud to offer the very best Parkerizing Tanks in the industry. They are cut and formed out of pure 304 stainless steel. Handles are formed right into the ends. All edges of these tanks are hemmed, so there are no exposed sharp edges. Feel free to handle these tank with your bare hands! 

The tanks are TIG welded using supreme skill and elaborate tooling. The outside of the welds are treated and polished to reveal the beauty of the stainless steel and show the excellence of the weld. We maintain complete passivation inside the weld during manufacturing. Please look at the last picture taken of the inside of the weld, you will see that it remains brilliant and shiny. If you see a weld in stainless steel that is black or rust colored inside this means that proper provisions were not taken and rust and breakdown will start immediately when your liquid is applied.
